quiz.question: What is the common English name for the base-60 number system?
Which writing system represents consonants only and requires vowels be inferred?
Which alphabetic script reformer created Armenian letters roughly in the year 405 CE?
Which modern script was created in the 15th century to write Korean?
Which alphabet was created by Mesrop Mashtots in the early 5th century?
Which script developed for Slavic languages in the 9th century has two early forms, Glagolitic and Cyrillic?
Which alphabet introduced the letter forms that evolved into the modern Latin alphabet?
Which property describes Roman numerals compared to positional systems?
Which alphabetic concept distinguishes between phonemic letters and suprasegmental marks like accents?
What is the standard number of letters in the modern English alphabet?
Which modern standard encodes over a million characters across multiple planes?
Which innovative Hangul feature encodes phonological features into letter shapes, classifying it as what type?
Which character set standard extends ASCII and assigns code points to virtually all scripts?
Which alphabetic order tradition places letters in the same sequence as Phoenician origin?
Which early printed work standardized many letter shapes in Latin script during the Renaissance?
